page.title: 03Botanic Gardens:Purpose/Use
page.content: The garden is part of the university department of botany. It is widely used by those both learning and teach- ing botany,helping them by growing a wide variety of plants both indoors and outdoors. Horticultural colleges also gain much interest out of the garden. The present area of 40 acres was founded in 1831 but an earlier garden of 5 acres had been established in the city centre since 1762 (the site is now occupied by laboratories). The garden was not completed till 1951 when the late Mr Reginald Cory left a large bequest for the gardens in his will. There are many notable features including its splendid collection of trees,several different kinds of rock- eries including limestone and tufa, chronological beds, an area left to grow wild like a fen, herbaceous beds and many interesting and exotic plants
